Identification.LongTitle: Royal Canadian Mounted Police (Dependants) Pension Fund Increase in Benefits Order

Provision.Text: Whereas it appears from a report made under section 56 of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police Pension Continuation Acta that the Royal Canadian Mounted Police (Dependants) Pension Fund is substantially in excess of the amount required to make adequate provision for the prospective payments out of it;

Therefore, His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Public Safety and Emergency Preparedness, pursuant to subsection 57(1) of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police Pension Continuation Acta, makes the annexed Royal Canadian Mounted Police (Dependants) Pension Fund Increase in Benefits Order.

Section.Text: The following pension benefits, as provided in Part IV of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police Pension Continuation Act1, are to be increased in the following manner:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: pensions for current and prospective widows are to be increased by 1.9% on April 1 in each of the 2017, 2018 and 2019 plan years;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: lump sum benefits payable on the death of a former member who contributed to the plan and who is not survived by a widow are to be increased by 1.9% on April 1 in each of the 2017, 2018 and 2019 plan years; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: residual amounts payable on the death of a former member’s widow are to be calculated with a deemed increase in the former member’s contributions of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 1,298% if the widow’s death occurs in the 2018 plan year,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 1,325% if the widow’s death occurs in the 2019 plan year, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 1,352% if the widow’s death occurs in the 2020 plan year.

Section.Text: This Order comes into force on April 1, 2017 or, if it is registered after that day, it comes into force on the day on which it is registered.
